job_history.work_description: Conducted research-based professional development trainings for teachers and staff in Direct Interactive Instruction, Common Core implementation strategies, and achievement-focused coaching. Provided training and assistance in standards-based lesson design to support all students, with a particular focus on English Language Learners. Delivered in-classroom coaching services that included demonstration lessons, co-plan/co-teach sessions, and observation/feedback consultations.

Served as Coordinator, Reading Lions Project, K-3, funded by Packard Humanities Institute (PHI); scheduled and organized project-wide meetings and events, acted as liaison between PHI and 27 California school district coordinators. Served as Coordinator, Instructor Recruitment and Support, Reading First and AB466/SB472 Institutes; recruited, hired, scheduled, monitored, and evaluated up to 600 seasonal instructors for statewide five-day, 40 hour professional development institutes.

Served as Coordinator, Reading Lions Project, K-3, funded by Packard Humanities Institute (PHI); scheduled and organized project-wide meetings and events, acted as liaison between PHI and 27 California school district coordinators. Served as Coordinator, Instructor Recruitment and Support, Reading First and AB466/SB472 Institutes; recruited, hired, scheduled, monitored, and evaluated up to 600 seasonal instructors for statewide five-day, 40 hour professional development institutes.

Provided instruction in multiple content areas to develop academic skills, differentiating as needed for GATE, struggling students, and English Language Learners. Collaborated with fellow teachers and administrators on instructional practice. Assessed, recorded, and communicated students' academic and social/behavioral progress.

skills.name: Instructional Coaching
skills.explanation: Has extensive experience providing coaching services to teachers and staff, including demonstration lessons, co-plan/co-teach sessions, and observation/feedback consultations, indicating expert-level mastery.

skills.name: Curriculum Development
skills.explanation: Has experience serving as a Curriculum Specialist for English Language Arts, including coordinating projects and recruiting instructors, suggesting strong proficiency.

skills.name: Professional Development
skills.explanation: Has experience conducting research-based professional development trainings for teachers and staff, including training on Direct Interactive Instruction and Common Core implementation strategies, indicating strong proficiency.

skills.name: Classroom Management
skills.explanation: Has experience providing instruction to students and collaborating with fellow teachers and administrators on instructional practice, showing a solid working proficiency.

skills.name: Leadership
skills.explanation: Has experience serving as a coordinator for various projects, including the Reading Lions Project and Instructor Recruitment and Support, indicating a solid level of proficiency in leadership.

skills.name: Communication
skills.explanation: Has experience communicating with students, teachers, and administrators, including assessing, recording, and communicating students' academic and social/behavioral progress, showing a solid working proficiency.

skills.name: Project Management
skills.explanation: Has experience managing projects, including scheduling and organizing meetings and events, and recruiting and evaluating instructors, indicating a solid working proficiency.
